net.viktorc.pp4j.api

Interface JavaProcessOptions

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SimpleJavaProcessOptions

    public interface JavaProcessOptions
    An interface for the definition of the timeout of Java processes and the options for the "java" program to enable performance optimization for the forking of JVMs.
    Author:
    Viktor Csomor

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  JavaProcessOptions.JVMArch
      The definitions of the different possible JVM architectures.
      static class  JavaProcessOptions.JVMType
      The definitions of the possible JVM types.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default JavaProcessOptions.JVMArch getArch()
      Returns the architecture the JVM should use, i.e.
      default int getInitHeapSizeMb()
      Returns the minimum and hence initial heap size the JVM should use in megabytes.
      default long getKeepAliveTime()
      Determines the duration of continuous idleness after which the process is to be terminated.
      default int getMaxHeapSizeMb()
      Returns the maximum heap size the JVM should use in megabytes.
      default int getStackSizeKb()
      Return the max stack size the JVM should use in kilobytes.
      default JavaProcessOptions.JVMType getType()
      Returns the type of the JVM, i.e.

    • Method Detail

      • getArch

        default JavaProcessOptions.JVMArch getArch()
        Returns the architecture the JVM should use, i.e. 32-bit or 64-bit. If it returns null, the option is not to be set. By default, it returns null.
        Returns:
        The architecture of the JVM.

      • getType

        default JavaProcessOptions.JVMType getType()
        Returns the type of the JVM, i.e. client or server. If it returns null, the option is not to be set. By default, it returns null.
        Returns:
        The type of the JVM.

      • getInitHeapSizeMb

        default int getInitHeapSizeMb()
        Returns the minimum and hence initial heap size the JVM should use in megabytes. If it returns 0, the option is not to be set. By default, it returns 0.
        Returns:
        The minimum heap size of the JVM in megabytes.

      • getMaxHeapSizeMb

        default int getMaxHeapSizeMb()
        Returns the maximum heap size the JVM should use in megabytes. If it returns 0, the option is not to be set. By default, it returns 0.
        Returns:
        The maximum heap size of the JVM in megabytes.

      • getStackSizeKb

        default int getStackSizeKb()
        Return the max stack size the JVM should use in kilobytes. If it returns 0, the option is not to be set. By default, it returns 0.
        Returns:
        The max stack size of the JVM in kilobytes.

      • getKeepAliveTime

        default long getKeepAliveTime()
        Determines the duration of continuous idleness after which the process is to be terminated. The process is considered idle if it is started up and not processing any submission. If it returns 0 or less, the life span of the process is not limited. By default, it returns 0.
        Returns:
        The number of milliseconds of idleness after which the process is to be terminated.
